name: intro
messages: Welcome! I'm your incubator mentor. Running a successful startup is not easy, but I'll give you guidance.
You're just starting out, so you'll work from your apartment for now.
This is the Office view. Here you can manage your company, create products, poke around the office, and more.
Right now it's just your cofounder in the office, but eventually you'll have a buzzing hive of talented employees.
Every successful company has to have a Product, so let's try creating one.

name: create_product
messages: Products are created by combining two different Product Types.
You only have a couple to choose from now, but later you can unlock and purchase more.
Some combinations lead to wildly successful products and some end up in duds. You'll have to innovate by experimenting with different combinations.
For now just pick any two and get started.

name: product_development
messages: Products take time to develop, depending on the productivity of your employees. Some product types are more difficult than others, requiring longer to finish.
As your company develops a product, your employees contribute Design, Engineering, and Marketing skills. These affect the final product in different ways.
We'll see what this means after the product is finished.

name: product_finished
messages: Your product is finished!
When a product is finished, it is launched into The Market, where you'll battle a competitor for market share.

name: the_market
messages: Welcome to The Market! The tiles with dollar signs are different pieces of market share of varying income levels.
Your product's revenue depends on how much market share you can capture from The Market.
The blue cubes on the map represent your products. They have different stats which are affected by the Design, Engineering, and Marketing skill that went into the product.
Design influences the number of moves each product has.
Engineering influences the health each product has.
Marketing influences the strength each product has.
Products can capture market share tiles - the speed of capture depends on their strength - and they can fight head-to-head and destroy competitors products.
The Market battle ends when there are no more market shares left to capture, if one player is eliminated, or if the turns run out.
Good luck!

name: recruiting
messages: Now that you're finished with The Market, your product will start generating some revenue.
The revenue generated depends on some factors, most importantly how much of The Market you were able to capture.
To capture more of The Market you need to build better products.
And to build better products, you need the best talent.
Let's hire an employee through the Recruiting button.

name: recruiting_strategies
messages: To recruit employees, you must first select a recruiting strategy.
Some recruiting strategies are more costly but are more likely to bring the cream of the crop. Others are cheaper but may reveal a diamond in the rough you can shape to be something great.
Why don't you pick one and see which candidates come through?

name: hiring
messages: We've got a few candidates lined up. Take a look and see if there are any you like.
Candidates have different skill levels, typically specializing in one thing. Sometimes you'll find a Unicorn candidate that excels in everything.
Some candidates also have special attributes which can confer bonuses to themselves or to all employees at the company. Keep an eye out for these ones.
If there's a candidate you like, click Negotiate to start the hiring process.

name: negotiation
messages: Each candidate has some minimum salary they're willing to accept. You won't know what it is, but you can influence it through negotiations.
Negotiations consist of, for instance, trying to convince the candidate of intangible benefits of the workplace so that they are willing to accept a lower salary.

Of course, different candidates have different personalities, so they respond to things differently. What may convince one candidate to take a lower salary might cause another to demand more compensation.
It's up to you to get a feel for what a candidate responds to through this process.
When you feel ready, you can make an offer.
If the candidate refuses, you have one more chance to make a different offer.
Otherwise, the candidate accepts a competing offer and may be off the job market for some time.

name: employees
messages: Congratulations on your first employee!
Employees are the lifeblood of your company. Keep up with them by selecting them in the office or by opening the Employees menu item.

name: productTypes
messages: You might be feeling a little limited by the product types your company can develop. In the Product Types menu you can purchase more to work with.

name: verticals
messages: You can access even more product types by expanding into new Verticals.
When you start cross-pollinating across different Verticals, you'll really start to see some Innovation!

name: specialProject
messages: Special projects are expensive undertakings but can lead to massive Market advantages and open up totally new revenue streams.
Each special project has a few prerequisite products that must be innovated before the special project is available.

name: acquisitions
messages: Is another company getting in your way? You could always acquire them.

name: lobbying
messages: The government does not have to be an enemy to the Market; it can be a strong ally.

name: research
messages: To most effectively innovate, you need an Innovation Labs - here is where all your bleeding edge research is carried out.

name: perks
messages: Happy employees are better employees - perks attract and retain the best talent and keep them at the office for longer.
Most perks can be upgraded too!

name: locations
messages: In order to keep growing, you'll have to expand to other cities and eventually countries.
Expanding to new locations gives access to new markets, and some places even provide nice bonuses!
Each new location will act as a remote office that will contribute Design, Engineering, and Marketing to your products.
